item.title: TOPOS 2025: The Living Earth Show presents Lazyhorse in Troy | Aug. 28
item.description: Date: Thursday, August 28, 2025 7:00 PM - 8:30 PM - FREE all-ages show! For TOPOS, Pulitzer Prize–winning composer and visual artist Raven Chacon returns to music’s most raw and immediate form: the band. Drawing on his roots in noise, thrash, and metal (Tenderizor, KILT, White People Killed Them), Chacon channels that energy into an excavation of American musical traditions: country, folk, and their haunted echoes. One night only!

item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 3, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - This 30-minute information session is hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., and will focus on Rensselaer’s Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree. item.title: Dr. Jennifer Pazour Named IISE Fellow in Recognition of Contributions to Industrial and Systems Engineering
item.description: The ISE Department is proud to announce that Dr. Jennifer Pazour has been named a Fellow of the Institute of Industrial and Systems Engineers (IISE), one of the highest honors awarded by IISE. This prestigious recognition reflects Dr. Pazour’s sustained contributions to research, education, service, and leadership within the field of industrial and systems engineering. Her career centers around solving complex logistics and supply chain challenges through mathematical modeling and optimization.

item.title: TOPOS presents Persepolis: Troy 2025 by Iannis Xenakis x Micah Silver | Aug. 29
item.description: Date: Friday, August 29, 2025 9:00 PM - 10:00 PM - Experience a seminal work of 20th-century sound art—reframed as an immersive 55-minute installation-performance. Composed in 1971 for a ritual performance amid the ruins of the ancient city of Persepolis, Iran, this eight-channel work invoked fire, movement, and night sky as a sonic act of resistance. At EMPAC, it resounds in a different kind of temple—one built not to glorify power, but to listen.
